instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 board makes strange noise when LCD connected
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board - tested with new LCD and LCD cable.
When backlight works board makes strange noise - any idea what makes that noise?
Removed L9701 - no more noise, image on LCD works... L9701 back on place and noise again.

threads.title: 820-2936 board makes strange noise when LCD connected
threads.message:
Backlight was always on max brightness so brightens was only as ON/OFF.

Replaced LP8550 and no more noise and brightens was fine - SOLVED.

threads.title: 820-2936 board makes strange noise when LCD connected
threads.message: Nicely done! Definitely will keep that in the memory bank.
